strIntroduction: Visit the famous Fushimi Inari Shrine, stroll through the cellars of sake barrels and take a sip of some traditionally-made sake Discover the original sake brewing techniques and traditions Have a taste of the finest sake made from naturally purified spring water flowing from Fushimi Hill (optional) Stroll through the iconic orange gates of Fushimi Inari Shrine Experienced English speaking guide services plus hotel pick up included Discover the original sake brewing techniques and traditions Have a taste of the finest sake made from naturally purified spring water flowing from Fushimi Hill (optional) Stroll through the iconic orange gates of Fushimi Inari Shrine Experienced English speaking guide services plus hotel pick up included What We Love:   What We Love: As is often the case, modern technology often leaves ancient traditions behind and the original art is lost. On this tour, that's not the case! Go back in time on a journey to see the original sake making process. Wander through the depths of sake cellars, taste-test the unique flavors and discover the authentic techniques used in brewing Japan's beloved rice wine beverage, a tradition preserved for over 1000 years. Complete with experience with a visit to the iconic orange torii gates of Fushimi Inari Shrine, one of Kyoto's most iconic landmarks in a tranquil forest setting.
strTitle: Sake Brewery Visit & Fushimi Inari Shrine

strIntroduction: Travel by bus to discover both the old and newer side to Hokkaido's most populous city. Guided headsets, stops at a number of places of interest and historic monuments - the ideal city tour! Take in the historic sights and discover one of Japan's trendiest cities Stop off at the intriguing Hokkaido Shrine and discover local Sapporo at the city's famous wholesale market Drive by the iconic Sapporo Tower, standing an impressive 147 meters high, from the grounds of nearby Odori Park Choose from English, Chinese or Korean on your own personal headset to accompany the tour and learn more about the city Take in the historic sights and discover one of Japan's trendiest cities Stop off at the intriguing Hokkaido Shrine and discover local Sapporo at the city's famous wholesale market Drive by the iconic Sapporo Tower, standing an impressive 147 meters high, from the grounds of nearby Odori Park Choose from English, Chinese or Korean on your own personal headset to accompany the tour and learn more about the city What We Love:   What We Love: Enjoy the historic sights of Sapporo as well as some other charms of one of Japan's most vibrant cities on a half-day morning bus tour. Discover some of Sapporo's older sights such as the Hokkaido Shrine where three sacred deities are enshrined, and stroll the grounds taking in the iconic cherry blossom gardens. Next up is the city's iconic Shiroi Koibito Park, famed for its confectionary production. See up close how this well-known Hokkaido export is made, and be sure to have a taste before ending the tour in the bustling Central Wholesale Market. With old and modern Sapporo both covered, this tour is ideal for those wanting to get a deeper understanding of one of Japan's most happening cities.

Begin your custom trip at the iconic train station or at one of the bridges arching over the central canal. Discover Otaru's hidden charms as you enjoy a calming summer breeze or snuggle up close to your companion as you're guided through romantic snow covered streets in winter. Enjoy the breathtaking scenery from a higher vantage point whilst your rickshaw glides by the primeval piers, canals and stockyards.

Next up head to the Hitsujigaoka Observation Hill and the Okurayama Ski Jump Stadium before turning back to the bright lights of the city and visiting the Sapporo Dome, perhaps one of the most iconic stadia built for when Japan co-hosted the Football World Cup in 2002. An all-round adventure and the perfect way to be introduced to this great city!

strIntroduction: Admire two of Hokkaido's most famous sightseeing spots: Asahiyama Zoo and Farm Tomita, with the convenience of a bus day tour from Sapporo Visit the diverse range of animals with a ticket to Asahiyama Zoo including polar bears, penguins and orangutans! Make the popular summer pilgrimage to see the lavender at Farm Tomita View beautiful Hokkaido sights from the road including the flora of aptly named 'Patchwork Road' Enjoy the convenience of hotel pick up and drop off plus a information pamphlet in English provided on the bus Visit the diverse range of animals with a ticket to Asahiyama Zoo including polar bears, penguins and orangutans! Visit the diverse range of animals with a ticket to Asahiyama Zoo including polar bears, penguins and orangutans! When the good weather arrives, Hokkaido bursts in to bloom, and there's no better place to experience it that Farm Tomita. Famed for it's fragrant lavender, the farm purple flowers bloom alongside a patchwork of other flora. The popular zoo and aquarium, Asahiyama, is another must-visit in Hokkaido. Home to over 700 animals of 124 different species, specialising in breeding creatures whose natural habitat is in cold climates such as polar bears and Amur leopards. Don't miss the daily penguin walk, the orangutan trapeze and the seal marineway and appreciate the zoo's immense efforts to imitate a natural environment.

Take in the sweeping views of stunning Sapporo from the thrilling observation deck, 90 meters in the sky Don't miss the Sapporo TV Tower beautifully lit up at night (click here for the latest light up schedule) The best viewing point for incredible unrestricted views of the Sea of Japan and Ishikari Heigen Located next to Odori Park - a popular destination for local Hokkaido residents to relax and unwind Complimentary WiFi is available at the observation deck Don't miss the Sapporo TV Tower beautifully lit up at night (click here for the latest light up schedule) click here The best viewing point for incredible unrestricted views of the Sea of Japan and Ishikari Heigen Located next to Odori Park - a popular destination for local Hokkaido residents to relax and unwind Complimentary WiFi is available at the observation deck What We Love:   What We Love: Built in 1957, the Sapporo TV Tower is one of the city's iconic landmarks. Standing 147.2 meters tall, the tower is a standout feature on the Sapporo skyline and a visit to the observation deck offers guests totally unobstructed 360 views to take in the beauty of one of Japan's greenest cities. It is 60 seconds by elevator from the third floor to the observation deck 90.38 meters above ground giving a dramatic bird's eye view of Sapporo. Set to a background of the magnificent Ishikari countryside, the far afield Japan Sea, and Odori Park where flowers bloom in the four seasons, this experience is a must-do when in Hokkaido's biggest and most vibrant city.

Enjoy the thrills of the fast paced snowmobile-pulled activities such as snow rafting, small snow motorcycling or the snow banana boat. No matter where you decide to go, there will be many beautiful photo opportunities so bring a fully charged camera!

Travel to Takachiho Gorge, the epitome of Japanese natural beauty, for boating, nature walks and ancient landmarks visits Take a walk along Takachiho Gorge and hear of the many ancient myths surrounding the stunning rock formations Enjoy the convenience and ease of a small group tour and avoid long queues for boating in the gorge with an early start Visit several cave locations which are connected to ancient Japanese mythology and folklore Enjoy refreshing cold wheat flour noodles, soumen, served inside bamboo pipes during the summer months Take a walk along Takachiho Gorge and hear of the many ancient myths surrounding the stunning rock formations Enjoy the convenience and ease of a small group tour and avoid long queues for boating in the gorge with an early start Visit several cave locations which are connected to ancient Japanese mythology and folklore Enjoy refreshing cold wheat flour noodles, soumen, served inside bamboo pipes during the summer months What We Love:   What We Love: Trace the paths of the gods and travel to one of the most beautiful scenic spots in Kyushu, the Takachiho Gorge. The natural wonder was formed from a natural phenomenon by the Aso volcanos when sudden cooling led to spectacular cliffs that rise between 80 to 100 meters above the river. Some of the region's most sacred and mythical locations can be found around the gorge such as Takachicho Shrine, an 1800 year old shrine home to a grove of evergreen trees which can claim an impressive 800 years. One of the best ways to view the gorge is by boat â come face to face with the 17 meter Manai Falls on your half hour paddle.

Kyushu is aptly named the "Land of Fire" with huge caldera volcanoes surrounding the entire island. In fact, the Sakurajima is an active smoking volcano that is located right in the center of the Kagoshima Prefecture. Whether you're going for the world class Saga beef or the famous Kumamoto Castle, the 3 or 5 day Kyushu JR rail pass is the best choice for efficient, affordable and convenient travel around the island.

strIntroduction: Be transported to the European style theme park, Huis Ten Bosch, with ease and comfort with round trip train tickets from Hakata Station in Fukuoka Enjoy a quick and stress-free ride from Hakata to Huis Ten Bosch theme park with express round trip train tickets Enjoy the Dutch-themed attractions of Huis Ten Bosch theme park with expansive grounds covering over 1 million sq meters See different flowers around the park depending on which season you go including tulips, roses, sunflowers and begonias Enjoy a quick and stress-free ride from Hakata to Huis Ten Bosch theme park with express round trip train tickets Enjoy the Dutch-themed attractions of Huis Ten Bosch theme park with expansive grounds covering over 1 million sq meters See different flowers around the park depending on which season you go including tulips, roses, sunflowers and begonias What We Love:   What We Love: A charming theme park in Nagasaki Prefecture, Huis Ten Bosch is named after one of the official residences of the Dutch royal family. Translating to 'House in the Woods', Huis Ten Bosch has been perfectly recreated to resemble Dutch style with copies of Netherlands architecture, beautiful gardens, iconic windmills and long canals. The train shuttles you from Japan to the streets of Europe with no need to worry about traffic, giving you more time to spend exploring the 700 species of tulips and the four meter high Tulip Mt. Fuji! If you're visiting during winter, prepare to be dazzled by the Kingdom of Lights, where the entire park is aglow with over 13 million multicolor lightbulbs.
strTitle: Huis Ten Bosch Ticket & Train Pass

strIntroduction: Round trip Fukuoka to Nagasaki train tickets plus a full day pass for the Nagasaki electric trams will make Nagasaki a convenient day trip in Japan Enjoy an efficient and speedy Shinkansen train from Hakata to Nagasaki with express round trip train tickets Take advantage of the one day unlimited Nagasaki tramway pass to visit the city's best landmarks Enjoy the flexibility of self-collecting your tickets or having them mailed to you Enjoy an efficient and speedy Shinkansen train from Hakata to Nagasaki with express round trip train tickets Take advantage of the one day unlimited Nagasaki tramway pass to visit the city's best landmarks Enjoy the flexibility of self-collecting your tickets or having them mailed to you What We Love:   What We Love: As a center of Portuguese and Dutch influence throughout the 16th and 19th centuries, the small fishing village of Nagasaki has today developed to become an East-meets-West city boasting a fusion of churches, shrines and temples. Most people are familiar with Nagasaki as the city to experience the world's second atomic bombing during World War II. The Peace Park was established close to the center of the explosion to commemorate the atomic bombing of Nagasaki and as a symbol of peace for the future. Rich in history and culture, Nagasaki is a great place to visit as a day trip from Fukuoka. With discounted train travel from Fukuoka to Nagasaki with express round trip tickets plus a one day pass on Nagasaki electric trams, getting there and around will a breeze.

Travel to two regions, Kurokawa and Aso, known for their natural beauty on a Fukuoka day tour for an outdoor hot spring bath and volcanic mountain views Enjoy an outdoor hot spring bath at a Kurokawa onsen spa suited to your preferences Take in the view of the caldera at the Aso region from the famous Daikanbo viewpoint Learn about the myths and festivals in the Aso region at one of the oldest shrines in Japan Visit two beautiful regions in one day with a customized tour plan Enjoy an outdoor hot spring bath at a Kurokawa onsen spa suited to your preferences Take in the view of the caldera at the Aso region from the famous Daikanbo viewpoint Learn about the myths and festivals in the Aso region at one of the oldest shrines in Japan Visit two beautiful regions in one day with a customized tour plan What We Love:   What We Love: Fit two must see places in Kyushu region into a day tour with special guides who personalize your tour around the best attractions in both Aso and Kurokawa. With a mind-boggling array of outdoor hot springs to choose from with different views, sizes, privacy and settings, discuss your preferences with your guide to get the best onsen to suit you. Then, head to Aso for a stunning panoramic view of the whole active volcano or a special drive to Laputa Road where the caldera edge looks to be floating in a sea of clouds. The personalized itinerary allows you to relax throughout the day while not missing out on places high on your bucket list.
strTitle: Kurokawa Onsen and Aso Day Tour

strIntroduction: Visit the stunning Kumamoto Castle and other landmarks with discounted round trip train tickets from Fukuoka and an inter-city travel pass for Kumamoto Get the ultimate convenience for a stress-free ride from Hakata to Kumamoto with express round trip Shinkansen train tickets Enjoy the Waka Waka 1 day pass for unlimited travel on the city's buses, trains and trams Explore the city with the famous Kumamon mascot, Japan's most popular bear Get the ultimate convenience for a stress-free ride from Hakata to Kumamoto with express round trip Shinkansen train tickets Enjoy the Waka Waka 1 day pass for unlimited travel on the city's buses, trains and trams Explore the city with the famous Kumamon mascot, Japan's most popular bear What We Love:   What We Love: Located in the center of Kyushu Island, the name Kumamoto means 'origins of the bear' - so it's no surprise then that the cute black bear with red cheeks known as 'Kumamon' is the beloved mascot of the city. The pride of the city is Kumamoto Castle - the 400 year old castle is known to be one of the most beautiful in Japan. At the heart of the city, hundreds of blossoms fill the castle grounds during the cherry blossom season. Other noteworthy landmarks are Suizenji Gardens, Shiki no Sato Park, Kumamoto Prefectural Traditional Crafts Center and Hasokawa Gyobutei. In addition, with the one day Waka Waka pass, you get unlimited travel on all buses, trams and trains in the city!

Travel to significant sites of Hakata and Fukuoka's trading past including shopping streets and produce markets Sip tea and relax at Rakusui Garden, a graceful pond garden built in the Meiji era Walk down Minoshima shopping street where you will experience Showa period shops and customs Enjoy the fresh seafood and vegetables at Yanagibashi Market Sip tea and relax at Rakusui Garden, a graceful pond garden built in the Meiji era Walk down Minoshima shopping street where you will experience Showa period shops and customs Enjoy the fresh seafood and vegetables at Yanagibashi Market What We Love:   What We Love: The historically strategic trading port of Hakata is still brimming with the merchant atmosphere of its past. At the Minoshima shopping street, be transported back to the Showa period where you will be able to experience the warmth and friendliness of local merchants who own family-run businesses. After you have indulged in traditional snacks and browsed local produce and trinkets, continue onwards to Yanagibashi market which is also known as 'Hakata's Kitchen'. This has been the main source of meat, fish, vegetables and other local produce for restaurants and residents of Fukuoka for over 100 years.

Enjoy a traditional donko river cruise and special Yamecha green tea experience in Fukuoka plus a typical Japanese lunch Enjoy the natural beauty of Japanese cherry blossoms as you cruise along the Yanagawa river Relish a local Yanagawa speciality, 'Yanagawa Unagi Seiro-mushi' (steamed eel), for lunch Experience a special green tea tasting session and visit the archive museum to find out more about Yame tea For an extra special experience rent a kimono as you view the cherry blossoms, please click here Enjoy the natural beauty of Japanese cherry blossoms as you cruise along the Yanagawa river Relish a local Yanagawa speciality, 'Yanagawa Unagi Seiro-mushi' (steamed eel), for lunch Experience a special green tea tasting session and visit the archive museum to find out more about Yame tea For an extra special experience rent a kimono as you view the cherry blossoms, please click here click here What We Love:   What We Love: Cruise down the famous Yanagawa river on a traditional gondola-like 'donko' boat as you take in the Japanese architecture, early 20th century warehouses and seasonal flowers. The tranquil and slow paced ride makes it a great way to enjoy viewing Fukuoka's cherry blossoms in the midst of nature. Continue the day with a special tea tasting session at the oldest tea wholesaler in the Kyushu region, where you will enjoy a traditional 'Hoiro Baisen' Yame tea which is prepared by drying the leaves on Japanese paper and spreading them over charcoal fire.
strTitle: Yanagawa River Cruise and Tea Tasting

strIntroduction: Tour Dazaifu and Yanagawa, two fascinating cities in Fukuoka prefecture for a day by special sightseeing train Visit two cities in Fukuoka by special sightseeing trains, Tabito and Suito Enjoy a special Negitoro Don rice bowl for lunch and taste other local snacks Marvel at the historical landmarks and seasonal flowers along the Yanagawa river on a cruise Wear kimono in cherry blossoms, please click Visit two cities in Fukuoka by special sightseeing trains, Tabito and Suito Enjoy a special Negitoro Don rice bowl for lunch and taste other local snacks Marvel at the historical landmarks and seasonal flowers along the Yanagawa river on a cruise Wear kimono in cherry blossoms, please click click What We Love:   What We Love: You'll be sure to have a smile on your face boarding the special sightseeing trains Tabito and Suito which will take you to and from Dazaifu and Yanagawa in special carriages, decorated with cutesy Japanese patterns and designs. Savor the local delights of Dazaifu that include rice cakes, mochi and green tea before heading over to Dazaifu Tenman-gu â a shrine honoring the God of study, devotion and warding off evil. Continue by cruising down the famous Yanagawa river, known for its scenic beauty particularly during cherry blossom season in March and April, on a traditional 'donto' boat.

Visit a traditional handicraft exhibit, a local shrine and shopping areas popular with Hakata natives Explore the Hakata townhouse museum and handicraft exhibit to learn about traditional manufacturing skills Pay a visit to the Kushida shrine, a popular place of worship and see the traditional floats which take part in an annual 5km race Enjoy both a local street shopping and mall experience at Hakata Kawabata shopping street and Hakata Riverain mall Explore the Hakata townhouse museum and handicraft exhibit to learn about traditional manufacturing skills Pay a visit to the Kushida shrine, a popular place of worship and see the traditional floats which take part in an annual 5km race Enjoy both a local street shopping and mall experience at Hakata Kawabata shopping street and Hakata Riverain mall What We Love:   What We Love: As a historical trading hub, Hakata was once the center of goods being traded all over Japan and internationally. Before the shopping begins, visit locally famed Kushida shrine, the annual summer Hakata Gion Yamakasa festival is dedicated to the shrine and the intricately designed 10 meter high floats are displayed year round. As the traditional manufacturer of Japanese 'Hakata ningyo' dolls, the exhibition of the dolls and other local handicrafts are a must see in Fukuoka. Begin your real shopping expedition at Hakata's Kawabata shopping street - with over 100 stores it's hard to resist the souvenirs on offer. Continue on to the Hakata Riverain mall where you will also have the chance to sample various Japanese sauces accompanied by the local knowledge of your guide and translator.

Get an insight into Hakata's influential history on a day tour of the tomb of Xie Guoming and the famous Jotenji and Tochoji temples Learn about the life of Xie Guoming, a Chinese merchant who significantly contributed to the development of Hakata Enter Jotenji temple, founded 773 years ago and its accompanying zen garden Visit Tochoji temple, a historic Buddhist temple with an iconic five storey orange pagoda Learn about the life of Xie Guoming, a Chinese merchant who significantly contributed to the development of Hakata Enter Jotenji temple, founded 773 years ago and its accompanying zen garden Visit Tochoji temple, a historic Buddhist temple with an iconic five storey orange pagoda What We Love:   What We Love: Among the oldest cities in Japan, Hakata was originally a hub for Chinese merchants to trade their wares. During your three hour tour around the city, you will visit key locations of Hakata's development. Begin at the sakura tea store, a specialist in Yame and Japanese tea wares. Appreciate the craftsmanship before heading to the ancient tomb of Xie Guoming, an influential Chinese merchant in the Song dynasty and hear about his journey to riches. Continue on to two of the area's most ornate Japanese temples, Jotenji and Tochoji and discover hear the fascinating story of how noodles were introduced to Japan from China or marvel at the biggest (10.8 metres) wooden seated Buddha statue in Japan.

Discover the beautiful old streets and architecture of Hakata and find out about the local wares that the city is known for Walk through a Meiji period alley with classic architecture and various temples surrounding it Browse hakata dolls designed as seasonal gifts, and enjoy a special Obon festival lantern exhibition in summer Visit traditional local stores on Saimon Street - some with over 100 years of history Walk through a Meiji period alley with classic architecture and various temples surrounding it Browse hakata dolls designed as seasonal gifts, and enjoy a special Obon festival lantern exhibition in summer Visit traditional local stores on Saimon Street - some with over 100 years of history What We Love:   What We Love: Start off this unique Hakata tour by visiting a store selling the famous Japanese dolls the city is known for. Stroll down a quaint old street built in the Meiji period, the traditional architecture and atmosphere rivals that of Kyoto. Pay a visit to local temples including famous Shofukuji Temple, founded by the priest Yousai and the first Zen temple ever built in Japan. Yousai is crediting with first introducing tea to Japan from China. Next make your way to Saimon Kamaboko, a local store selling fish processed food for over 100 years. End the tour at the Nagasawa gift store to purchase souvenirs to remember your time in historic Hakata.

Bath in therapeutic comfort at a traditional hot spring resort in Fukuoka and explore the natural sights of northern Kumamoto's spectacular waterfall Enjoy a hot spring bath at the famous Kurokawa Onsen Village, one of Japan's best hot spring resorts Have the added flexibility of choosing your preferred itinerary and time spent at onsens â relax to the fullest or spend some time exploring the region Visit the newly discovered tourist location, Nabegataki Falls, a favorite spot for avid photographers with its 20 meters wide cascade Enjoy a hot spring bath at the famous Kurokawa Onsen Village, one of Japan's best hot spring resorts Have the added flexibility of choosing your preferred itinerary and time spent at onsens â relax to the fullest or spend some time exploring the region Visit the newly discovered tourist location, Nabegataki Falls, a favorite spot for avid photographers with its 20 meters wide cascade What We Love:   What We Love: Relax at the Kurokawa Onsen which is renowed for its traditional ryokans and outdoor hot springs where visitors are able to enjoy the therapeutic waters in a natural setting. With around 300 years of history, the onsen resort was traditionally patronized by wealthy visitors as a rest stop on their travels. Take your pick from a range of outside baths with a variety of different waters â you'll also be able to enjoy your bath in peace as the mornings are typically the quietest time of the day. After a refreshing bath, head over to natural cascading Nabegataki falls â the 20 meters wide falls is a rare formation from Mount Aso's eruptions over 90,000 years ago.

Discover the secrets of making tasty and authentic sushi guided by a passionate and skilful local chef Be expertly taught by an experienced local sushi chef, and learn from the best Learn the secrets of sushi making and make eight different types of sushi with a variety of fresh fish to choose from Sample your own delicious sushi served with miso soup and other Japanese snacks Be expertly taught by an experienced local sushi chef, and learn from the best Learn the secrets of sushi making and make eight different types of sushi with a variety of fresh fish to choose from Sample your own delicious sushi served with miso soup and other Japanese snacks What We Love:   What We Love: Discover the secrets to making Japan's favourite and most iconic food - sushi. Expertly guided by a skilled local chef, learn how to make 8 different types of sushi as well as an assortment of other classics such as miso soup. When you have finished putting the finishing touches to your own sushi, taste it for yourself and learn to appreciate this centuries old culinary art which in Japan is more like a philosophy than simply a food.

Relish the intriguing balance of culture and architecture from your comfortable rickshaw as you cruise down the most northern town in Kyushu Visit the pedestrian under-sea tunnel, the promenade along the Kanmon straights, which is not accessible by taxi or bus Stroll along the straights, enjoying the sight of various architectural structures matched with interesting and historical information provided by your friendly guide Visit the small town that balances various architectural styles side by side, varying from the renaissance style, Taisho Era and contemporary buildings Visit the pedestrian under-sea tunnel, the promenade along the Kanmon straights, which is not accessible by taxi or bus Stroll along the straights, enjoying the sight of various architectural structures matched with interesting and historical information provided by your friendly guide Visit the small town that balances various architectural styles side by side, varying from the renaissance style, Taisho Era and contemporary buildings What We Love:   What We Love: Enjoy Kanmon's renowned architecture and take in everything from historic Mekari Shrine, over to Kyushu's red brick buildings and the modern Kaikyo Plaza. Ride past a breathtaking harbor scene from the raised seat of your rickshaw and have your guide take many photos of you, while explaining the historical tales attached to each renaissance building you pass. Don't forget to find out at which social club Einstein stayed at during his visit to Japan. Your relaxing rickshaw tour will come to an end at a convenient location of your choice.

Enjoy an afternoon adorned in a beautiful kimono and visit the sights of historic Fukuoka Learn the art of dressing in a traditional Japanese kimono Choose from a number of colourful and beautiful designs Look the part with a professional makeup artist and hairstylist services included Enjoy a picture session with a professional photographer to ensure you take the memories away with you Learn the art of dressing in a traditional Japanese kimono Choose from a number of colourful and beautiful designs Look the part with a professional makeup artist and hairstylist services included Enjoy a picture session with a professional photographer to ensure you take the memories away with you What We Love:   What We Love: An iconic symbol of Japanese style and culture, the kimono still wows with it's beauty and elegance. This afternoon tour takes you around the streets of one of Japan's most famous and historic cities - Fukuoka. Tour the ancient city fully dressed in your kimono, with hair and makeup perfected too, and stop off at a number of famous landmarks such as the beautiful Kego Shrine. With kimonos for men too, make sure to capture the experience with a professional photographer on hand to get that perfect snap!

strIntroduction: For an easy and timely tour of Okinawa, come aboard the one day Hip Hop Bus Start the tour from one of six strategic boarding points Relax on the comfortable and spacious seats of the bus as you are guided to Okinawa's landmarks Stroll along Kouri beach, catch a free dolphin show at the Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium and hop on a pineapple cart at Nago Pineapple park Choose from 8 different languages on the personal headphone commentary for a comprehensive audio guide Start the tour from one of six strategic boarding points Relax on the comfortable and spacious seats of the bus as you are guided to Okinawa's landmarks Stroll along Kouri beach, catch a free dolphin show at the Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium and hop on a pineapple cart at Nago Pineapple park Choose from 8 different languages on the personal headphone commentary for a comprehensive audio guide What We Love:   What We Love: Hop aboard for a tour of Okinawa's famous landmarks on the island's most convenient bus service. Enjoy the scenic island landscape of Okinawa from your spacious seat on the sightseeing bus. The first stopover point in the tour is at Cape Manza, an impressive rock formation where you are able to take stunning pictures of the vast ocean. Tickets also include admission to the Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium, a world-class location with an impressive collection of sea creatures. strIntroduction: Enjoy a wonderful day out for the whole family and discover the amazing nature on show at Bios Park, a tranquil garden in Okinawa Take in the peaceful scenery of one of Japan's best urban gardens and parks Let the kids run wild and play with the cute and friendly wild animals on site Enjoy a 25 min boat ride through some of the park's most serene areas (optional) Take in the peaceful scenery of one of Japan's best urban gardens and parks Take in the peaceful scenery of one of Japan's best urban gardens and parks Let the kids run wild and play with the cute and friendly wild animals on site Let the kids run wild and play with the cute and friendly wild animals on site Enjoy a 25 min boat ride through some of the park's most serene areas (optional) Enjoy a 25 min boat ride through some of the park's most serene areas (optional) What We Love:   What We Love: Located in the peaceful surroundings of Ishikawa City, Bios Hill is the perfect location for a great family day out in Okinawa's blissful nature. Covering a considerable area, the park is a nature lover's dream with a forest where giant ferns grow in abundance, and a lake shore where wild birds and insects gather. Throughout the park, orchids bloom naturally from every corner, and a dense subtropical forest spreads. It's here you can enjoy the bounties of Mother Nature either by taking a gentle walk through the grounds or on board a boat. The boat ride lasts for around 25 minutes and takes you through some of the most stunning parts of the park. With lily ponds to discover, goats and pigs on the loose, and water buffalo cart rides, Bios Hill is a great option for families and nature lovers alike!

Increase your awareness of local culture and learn to make your own traditional crafts from Okinawa Use Okinawa's beautiful local coral as a dyeing tool for making your crafts Enjoy the cultural experience and make yourself a t-shirt, scarf, handbag or many other items Learn from some of Okinawa's most skilled artisans and craftsmen The arts and crafts element of this activity makes it an activity for the whole family to enjoy Use Okinawa's beautiful local coral as a dyeing tool for making your crafts Use Okinawa's beautiful local coral as a dyeing tool for making your crafts Enjoy the cultural experience and make yourself a t-shirt, scarf, handbag or many other items Enjoy the cultural experience and make yourself a t-shirt, scarf, handbag or many other items Learn from some of Okinawa's most skilled artisans and craftsmen Learn from some of Okinawa's most skilled artisans and craftsmen The arts and crafts element of this activity makes it an activity for the whole family to enjoy The arts and crafts element of this activity makes it an activity for the whole family to enjoy What We Love:   What We Love: Enjoy a great day out and make an original gift to give loved ones with the Shuri Ryusen experience. Ryusen has 43 years of history and has long played a big part in the Okinawan dyeing culture. Coral dyeing uses the natural shapes of coral to create your own pattern, then you can use this to create a gift such as a t-shirt or even a handbag. In Okinawa, corals are believed to bring happiness and bring prosperity and longevity, and with this in mind enjoy the experience with the kids and get them involved in finding out more out Okinawan culture in a fun and interactive way. The perfect day out for the whole family to enjoy!

In the heart of Nago City, Neo Park has nurtured a huge, open natural park introducing the most fascinating aspects of Okinawa's nature. At Flamingo Lake visitors are welcomed by the amazing sight of a multitude of free flying birds, whilst the park also features fresh water ponds, tropical flowers, and exotic animals. The park also houses replicas of animal habitats found in the Amazon jungle, African savannah, Southeast Asia and Oceania, a real treat for the kids to learn more about the animal kingdom. Finish the day's fun feeding the many rare animals and birds of the park or visit the petting zoo. Truly a memorable experience for the whole family to enjoy!

strIntroduction: Spend a day in the Japanese countryside exploring the beautifully preserved villages of the Gokayama region - famed for their steeped roof farmhouses Visit historic villages including two World Heritage Sites with the utmost ease on a one day bus tour Explore Suganuma and Ainokura, remote farmhouse villages in the Gokayama region Discover the steeped-roof traditional farmhouses of Shirakawago - some over 250 years old! Venture into some of the area's remotest villages, away from other tourists Learn about local history from your English speaking guide Transportation, lunch, guide fees and entrance to the Minkaen Outdoor Museum are all included Visit historic villages including two World Heritage Sites with the utmost ease on a one day bus tour Explore Suganuma and Ainokura, remote farmhouse villages in the Gokayama region Discover the steeped-roof traditional farmhouses of Shirakawago - some over 250 years old! Venture into some of the area's remotest villages, away from other tourists Learn about local history from your English speaking guide Transportation, lunch, guide fees and entrance to the Minkaen Outdoor Museum are all included What We Love:   What We Love: Venture deep into the Gokayama region to explore some fascinating countryside villages, known for their iconic steeped-roof gasshozukuri farmhouses. Enjoy the ease of hotel transfers and the help of an English speaking guide as you make your way into some of the region's remotest villages. This isn't your average group tour - the route is designed to aide your Japan sightseeing by taking you to some hard to reach locations, away from large tourist numbers. It's not a package tour - when you arrive at each location, you're given free time to explore by foot on your own. You'll visit the two World Heritage Sites of Suganuma and Ainokura villages, which remain as beautiful examples of local folk culture. Dine on fresh soba noodles and local tofu for lunch overlooking the iconic steeped-roofs of Shirakawago's farmhouses and get clued up on local history with free time at the Gasshozukuri Minkaen Outdoor Museum.

Don't miss the Tokugawa Art Museum in Nagoya to uncover an impressive collection of Japanese artefacts Visit one of Japan's best quality and diverse displays of Japanese cultural and historical art See and learn about the famed, hand illustrated Tale of Genki scroll from the 12th Century Home to 9 National Treasures, 59 registered Important Cultural Properties and 46 Important Art Objects Pick up your ticket at Chubu Centrair International Airport on arrival in Nagoya, visit the museum on any date Visit one of Japan's best quality and diverse displays of Japanese cultural and historical art Visit one of Japan's best quality and diverse displays of Japanese cultural and historical art See and learn about the famed, hand illustrated Tale of Genki scroll from the 12th Century See and learn about the famed, hand illustrated Tale of Genki scroll from the 12th Century Home to 9 National Treasures, 59 registered Important Cultural Properties and 46 Important Art Objects Home to 9 National Treasures, 59 registered Important Cultural Properties and 46 Important Art Objects Pick up your ticket at Chubu Centrair International Airport on arrival in Nagoya, visit the museum on any date Pick up your ticket at Chubu Centrair International Airport on arrival in Nagoya, visit the museum on any date What We Love:   What We Love: A must-visit museum in Nagoya for anyone with even the slightest interest in Japanese culture and history. Built on the site of one of the residences of the Edo Period's hugely wealthy Owari Tokugawa family, the museum houses an extensive and diverse collection of over 10,000 treasures including samurai swords, priceless scrolls, ancient tea sets, costumes, poems and maps. Many items are even designated National Treasures, Important Cultural Properties or Important Art Objects. If you're lucky, the world-famous Tale of Genji picture scrolls may be on display (or you can watch the video instead). Tie your trip in with a visit the the adjacent Tokugawa-en beautifully landscaped Japanese garden (not included with this ticket.)

Take a dive into millions of years of marine history at the Port of Nagoya Aquarium with a standard or combo admission ticket Don't miss the impressive dolphin shows and even get the chance to touch a dolphin! Visit the killer whales, beluga whales, penguins and a huge range of other marine animals Stay for feeding time at different tanks throughout the aquarium Choose from standard admission or opt for a combo ticket with additional access to an Observation Deck, the Maritime Museum and the South Pole research vessel 'Fuji' Don't miss the impressive dolphin shows and even get the chance to touch a dolphin! Don't miss the impressive dolphin shows and even get the chance to touch a dolphin! Visit the killer whales, beluga whales, penguins and a huge range of other marine animals Visit the killer whales, beluga whales, penguins and a huge range of other marine animals Stay for feeding time at different tanks throughout the aquarium Stay for feeding time at different tanks throughout the aquarium Choose from standard admission or opt for a combo ticket with additional access to an Observation Deck, the Maritime Museum and the South Pole research vessel 'Fuji' Choose from standard admission or opt for a combo ticket with additional access to an Observation Deck, the Maritime Museum and the South Pole research vessel 'Fuji' What We Love:   What We Love: Divided into two facilities, the Port of Nagoya Aquarium is a world class aquarium showcasing marine life from across the globe and boasting one of the largest outdoor tanks in the world. Embark on a journey spanning 3.5 billion years in the Nagoya Port Aquarium North Building and be introduced to the world of Cetaceans (such as whales, dolphins, porpoises), who have adapted to living in water and developed a magnificent intelligence, over years of evolution. You'll see killer whales perform, dolphins at play, and even beluga whales! Get a closer look at Japanese, Australian and Arctic marine life in the South Building and watch schools of fish at play, colorful corals, deep sea creatures, freshwater Australian life, turtles, and more than a few penguins! The South Building's main attraction is 'Fuji', an ice-cruising ship now on display in it's original condition (included in combo ticket only).

Be whisked away to another world in 7.5 minutes aboard the Komagatake Ropeway in Japan's Central Alps on a day trip from Nagoya Journey up to 2,612 meters at Senjojiki Station, the highest elevation of any station in Japan Get incredible panoramic views across the Senjojiki Cirque and to Mount Fuji in the distance Visit year-round to take in the scenic beauty in all four seasons Includes roundtrip bus tickets from Nagoya and roundtrip ropeway tickets plus a guide to help get you there Pick up your voucher at Chubu Centrair Airport on arrival in Nagoya, take the tour on any day - no advance booking required! Journey up to 2,612 meters at Senjojiki Station, the highest elevation of any station in Japan Get incredible panoramic views across the Senjojiki Cirque and to Mount Fuji in the distance Visit year-round to take in the scenic beauty in all four seasons Includes roundtrip bus tickets from Nagoya and roundtrip ropeway tickets plus a guide to help get you there Pick up your voucher at Chubu Centrair Airport on arrival in Nagoya, take the tour on any day - no advance booking required! What We Love:   What We Love: Take on this 450 second aerial adventure to discover the incredible beauty of Japan's Central Alps. Between the base at Shirabidaira Station (1,662m) up to Senjojiki Station (2,616m) you'll experience the largest ropeway elevation gain before you're rewarded with stunning views of Senjojiki Cirque directly below Mt. Hokendake. Operating in every season, showcasing summer blooms and wintry snows, you'll be able to see as far as the Southern Alps and Mt. Fuji from the top. Specifically designed for travelers arriving from Nagoya, this package includes convenient roundtrip bus transfers between Nagoya and Komagatake Ropeway, plus the help of a friendly guide to make sure you get there hassle-free. Just don't forget to pick up your voucher at Chubu Centrair Internation Airport when you arrive, and to redeem your physical tickets at Meitetsu Bus Center in Nagoya.

Get panoramic views of the city at Nagoya TV Tower as you tick off one of Nagoya's top tourist attractions from your list of things to do in Nagoya Scale one of Nagoya's most iconic structures View the city from a 90 meters high observation deck Get a 360 degree view of Nagoya and the surrounding area Take your partner to this designated 'Lover's Sanctuary' since 2008 Scale one of Nagoya's most iconic structures View the city from a 90 meters high observation deck Get a 360 degree view of Nagoya and the surrounding area Take your partner to this designated 'Lover's Sanctuary' since 2008 What We Love:   What We Love: Probably Nagoya's most iconic structure - beloved by locals and favoured by tourists - you can't miss venturing up to the 90 meter observation deck of Nagoya TV Tower. Towering above this fairly low-lying city, the Eiffel Tower-esque building was selected as a 'Lover's Sanctuary' in 2008 (you'll find an oversized heart sculpture inside to prove it!) From the top you'll get 360Â° views over the entire city and across to the hilly landscape in the distance. Purchase your discounted Nagoya TV Tower admission ticket in advance on Klook - and remember to pick up your tickets on arrival at Chubu Centrair International Airport.
